chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell L. Fair Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darrell L. Fair Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darrell L. Fair Jr was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).
  • Darrell L. Fair Jr was found guilty of Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment and also Cognitive Thinking.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP concurrent to 15CM448 & 14CF969; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 353 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 3 the court imposes a total sentence of 4years WSP concurrent to ct 1 and to 15CM448 & 14CF969; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 353 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 4 & 5 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 3.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 3.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/24/15 at 11am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states he has a report from the Dr, requests a short adjournment to attempt to work out a global resolution.  FPT continued to 6/5/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states an expert has been hired, is waiting on records, then the Dr can prepare a report and then they can work toward resolution of the case.  FPT continued to 5/28/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states they are in negotiations; states he intends to hire a psychologist.  FPT continued to 4/9/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states there have been further negotiations that he needs time to discuss w/deft.  FPT continued to 2/19/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states he relayed an offer to ADA Graveley, who has been in trial, so they are still in negotiations.  FPT continued to 1/29/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Atty:  M Perz.
Filed by Atty M Perz.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Michel states the deft is requesting new counsel, believes if he is allowed to withdraw that Atty Perz will be appointed on this case.  Court allows Atty Michel to withdraw as counsel.  FPT continued to 12/18/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Michel acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 10/17/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 11/6/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
